# CLI Reference

Documentation for Trustless Hub CLI.

# Trustless Hub

Trustless Hub offers everything you need to scaffold, test, build, and launch your blockchain

Synopsis

Trustless Hub is a tool for creating sovereign blockchains built with Cosmos SDK, the worldâ€™s most popular modular blockchain framework. Trustless Hub offers everything you need to scaffold, test, build, and launch your blockchain.

To get started, create a blockchain:

Trustless Hub scaffold chain github.com/cosmonaut/mars

Options

Copy -h, --help help for Trustless Hub

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub account](#Trustless Hub-account) - Commands for managing accounts
  • [Trustless Hub chain](#Trustless Hub-chain) - Build, initialize and start a blockchain node or perform other actions on the blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub docs](#Trustless Hub-docs) - Show Trustless Hub docs
  • [Trustless Hub generate](#Trustless Hub-generate) - Generate clients, API docs from source code
  • [Trustless Hub network](#Trustless Hub-network) - Launch a blockchain network in production
  • [Trustless Hub relayer](#Trustless Hub-relayer) - Connect blockchains by using IBC protocol
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold](#Trustless Hub-scaffold) - Scaffold a new blockchain, module, message, query, and more
  • [Trustless Hub tools](#Trustless Hub-tools) - Tools for advanced users
  • [Trustless Hub version](#Trustless Hub-version) - Print the current build information

# Trustless Hub account

Commands for managing accounts

Synopsis

Commands for managing accounts. An account is a pair of a private key and a public key. Trustless Hub uses accounts to interact with the Trustless Hub Network blockchain, use an IBC relayer, and more.

Options

Copy -h, --help help for account

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub](#Trustless Hub) - Trustless Hub offers everything you need to scaffold, test, build, and launch your blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub account create](#Trustless Hub-account-create) - Create a new account
  • [Trustless Hub account delete](#Trustless Hub-account-delete) - Delete an account by name
  • [Trustless Hub account export](#Trustless Hub-account-export) - Export an account as a private key
  • [Trustless Hub account import](#Trustless Hub-account-import) - Import an account by using a mnemonic or a private key
  • [Trustless Hub account list](#Trustless Hub-account-list) - Show a list of all accounts
  • [Trustless Hub account show](#Trustless Hub-account-show) - Show detailed information about a particular account

# Trustless Hub account create

Create a new account

Copy Trustless Hub account create [name] [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for create --keyring-backend string Keyring backend to store your account keys (default "test")

  • [Trustless Hub account](#Trustless Hub-account) - Commands for managing accounts

# Trustless Hub account export

Export an account as a private key

Copy Trustless Hub account export [name] [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for export --keyring-backend string Keyring backend to store your account keys (default "test") --non-interactive Do not enter into interactive mode --passphrase string Account passphrase --path string path to export private key. default: ./key_[name]

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub account](#Trustless Hub-account) - Commands for managing accounts

# Trustless Hub account import

Import an account by using a mnemonic or a private key

Copy Trustless Hub account import [name] [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for import --keyring-backend string Keyring backend to store your account keys (default "test") --non-interactive Do not enter into interactive mode --passphrase string Account passphrase --secret string Your mnemonic or path to your private key (use interactive mode instead to securely pass your mnemonic)

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub account](#Trustless Hub-account) - Commands for managing accounts

# Trustless Hub chain

Build, initialize and start a blockchain node or perform other actions on the blockchain

Synopsis

Build, initialize and start a blockchain node or perform other actions on the blockchain.

Options

Copy -h, --help help for chain -p, --path string path of the app (default ".")

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub](#Trustless Hub) - Trustless Hub offers everything you need to scaffold, test, build, and launch your blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub chain build](#Trustless Hub-chain-build) - Build a node binary
  • [Trustless Hub chain faucet](#Trustless Hub-chain-faucet) - Send coins to an account
  • [Trustless Hub chain init](#Trustless Hub-chain-init) - Initialize your chain
  • [Trustless Hub chain serve](#Trustless Hub-chain-serve) - Start a blockchain node in development

# Trustless Hub chain build

Build a node binary

Synopsis

By default, build your node binaries and add the binaries to your $(go env GOPATH)/bin path.

To build binaries for a release, use the --release flag. The app binaries for one or more specified release targets are built in a release/ dir under the app's source. Specify the release targets with GOOS:GOARCH build tags. If the optional --release.targets is not specified, a binary is created for your current environment.

Sample usages: - Trustless Hub chain build - Trustless Hub chain build --release -t linux:amd64 -t darwin:amd64 -t darwin:arm64

Copy Trustless Hub chain build [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for build --home string Home directory used for blockchains -o, --output string binary output path --proto-all-modules Enables proto code generation for 3rd party modules used in your chain. Available only without the --release flag --release build for a release --release.prefix string tarball prefix for each release target. Available only with --release flag -t, --release.targets strings release targets. Available only with --release flag -v, --verbose Verbose output

Options inherited from parent commands

Copy -p, --path string path of the app (default ".")

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub chain](#Trustless Hub-chain) - Build, initialize and start a blockchain node or perform other actions on the blockchain

# Trustless Hub chain serve

Start a blockchain node in development

Synopsis

Start a blockchain node with automatic reloading

Copy Trustless Hub chain serve [flags]

Options

Copy -c, --config string Trustless Hub config file (default: ./config.yml) -f, --force-reset Force reset of the app state on start and every source change -h, --help help for serve --home string Home directory used for blockchains --proto-all-modules Enables proto code generation for 3rd party modules used in your chain -r, --reset-once Reset of the app state on first start -v, --verbose Verbose output

Options inherited from parent commands

Copy -p, --path string path of the app (default ".")

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub chain](#Trustless Hub-chain) - Build, initialize and start a blockchain node or perform other actions on the blockchain

# Trustless Hub generate

Generate clients, API docs from source code

Synopsis

Generate clients, API docs from source code.

Such as compiling protocol buffer files into Go or implement particular functionality, for example, generating an OpenAPI spec.

Produced source code can be regenerated by running a command again and is not meant to be edited by hand.

Options

Copy -h, --help help for generate -p, --path string path of the app (default ".")

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub](#Trustless Hub) - Trustless Hub offers everything you need to scaffold, test, build, and launch your blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub generate openapi](#Trustless Hub-generate-openapi) - Generate generates an OpenAPI spec for your chain from your config.yml
  • [Trustless Hub generate proto-go](#Trustless Hub-generate-proto-go) - Generate proto based Go code needed for the app's source code
  • [Trustless Hub generate vuex](#Trustless Hub-generate-vuex) - Generate Vuex store for you chain's frontend from your config.yml

# Trustless Hub network

Launch a blockchain network in production

Options

Copy -h, --help help for network --local Use local SPN network --nightly Use nightly SPN network --spn-api-address string SPN api address (default "https://rest.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-faucet-address string SPN Faucet address (default "https://faucet.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-node-address string SPN node address (default "https://rpc.alpha.Trustless Hub.network:443")

# Trustless Hub network account

Show the underlying SPN account

Synopsis

Show the underlying SPN account. To pick another account see "Trustless Hub network account use -h" If no account is picked, default "spn" account is used.

Copy Trustless Hub network account [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for account

Options inherited from parent commands

Copy --local Use local SPN network --nightly Use nightly SPN network --spn-api-address string SPN api address (default "https://rest.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-faucet-address string SPN Faucet address (default "https://faucet.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-node-address string SPN node address (default "https://rpc.alpha.Trustless Hub.network:443")

# Trustless Hub network account use

Pick an account to be used with Trustless Hub Network

Synopsis

Pick one of the accounts in OS keyring to put into use or provide one with --name flag. Picked account will be used while interacting with Trustless Hub Network.

Copy Trustless Hub network account use [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for use -n, --name string Account name to put into use

Options inherited from parent commands

Copy --local Use local SPN network --nightly Use nightly SPN network --spn-api-address string SPN api address (default "https://rest.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-faucet-address string SPN Faucet address (default "https://faucet.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-node-address string SPN node address (default "https://rpc.alpha.Trustless Hub.network:443")

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub network account](#Trustless Hub-network-account) - Show the underlying SPN account

Options

Copy --gentx string Path to a gentx file (optional) -h, --help help for join --home string Home directory used for blockchains --keyring-backend string Keyring backend used for the blockchain account (default "os") --peer string Configure peer in node-id@host:port format (optional)

Options inherited from parent commands

Copy --local Use local SPN network --nightly Use nightly SPN network --spn-api-address string SPN api address (default "https://rest.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-faucet-address string SPN Faucet address (default "https://faucet.alpha.Trustless Hub.network") --spn-node-address string SPN node address (default "https://rpc.alpha.Trustless Hub.network:443")

Options

# Trustless Hub relayer

Connect blockchains by using IBC protocol

Options

Copy -h, --help help for relayer

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub](#Trustless Hub) - Trustless Hub offers everything you need to scaffold, test, build, and launch your blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub relayer configure](#Trustless Hub-relayer-configure) - Configure source and target chains for relaying
  • [Trustless Hub relayer connect](#Trustless Hub-relayer-connect) - Link chains associated with paths and start relaying tx packets in between

# Trustless Hub relayer configure

Configure source and target chains for relaying

Copy Trustless Hub relayer configure [flags]

Options

Copy -a, --advanced Advanced configuration options for custom IBC modules -h, --help help for configure --keyring-backend string Keyring backend to store your account keys (default "test") --ordered Set the channel as ordered --source-account string Source Account --source-faucet string Faucet address of the source chain --source-gaslimit int Gas limit used for transactions on source chain --source-gasprice string Gas price used for transactions on source chain --source-port string IBC port ID on the source chain --source-prefix string Address prefix of the source chain --source-rpc string RPC address of the source chain --source-version string Module version on the source chain --target-account string Target Account --target-faucet string Faucet address of the target chain --target-gaslimit int Gas limit used for transactions on target chain --target-gasprice string Gas price used for transactions on target chain --target-port string IBC port ID on the target chain --target-prefix string Address prefix of the target chain --target-rpc string RPC address of the target chain --target-version string Module version on the target chain

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub relayer](#Trustless Hub-relayer) - Connect blockchains by using IBC protocol

# Trustless Hub relayer connect

Link chains associated with paths and start relaying tx packets in between

Copy Trustless Hub relayer connect [<path>,...] [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for connect --keyring-backend string Keyring backend to store your account keys (default "test")

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub relayer](#Trustless Hub-relayer) - Connect blockchains by using IBC protocol

# Trustless Hub scaffold

Scaffold a new blockchain, module, message, query, and more

Synopsis

Scaffold commands create and modify the source code files to add functionality.

CRUD stands for "create, read, update, delete".

Options

Copy -h, --help help for scaffold

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub](#Trustless Hub) - Trustless Hub offers everything you need to scaffold, test, build, and launch your blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold band](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-band) - Scaffold an IBC BandChain query oracle to request real-time data
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold chain](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-chain) - Fully-featured Cosmos SDK blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold list](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-list) - CRUD for data stored as an array
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold map](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-map) - CRUD for data stored as key-value pairs
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold message](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-message) - Message to perform state transition on the blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold module](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-module) - Scaffold a Cosmos SDK module
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold packet](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-packet) - Message for sending an IBC packet
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold query](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-query) - Query to get data from the blockchain
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold single](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-single) - CRUD for data stored in a single location
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold type](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-type) - Scaffold only a type definition
  • [Trustless Hub scaffold vue](#Trustless Hub-scaffold-vue) - Vue 3 web app template

# Trustless Hub scaffold band

Scaffold an IBC BandChain query oracle to request real-time data

Synopsis

Scaffold an IBC BandChain query oracle to request real-time data from BandChain scripts in a specific IBC-enabled Cosmos SDK module

Copy Trustless Hub scaffold band [queryName] --module [moduleName] [flags]

Options

Copy -h, --help help for band --module string IBC Module to add the packet into -p, --path string path of the app (default ".") --signer string Label for the message signer (default: creator)

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub scaffold](#Trustless Hub-scaffold) - Scaffold a new blockchain, module, message, query, and more

# Trustless Hub scaffold chain

Fully-featured Cosmos SDK blockchain

Synopsis

Scaffold a new Cosmos SDK blockchain with a default directory structure

Copy Trustless Hub scaffold chain [github.com/org/repo] [flags]

Options

Copy --address-prefix string Address prefix (default "cosmos") -h, --help help for chain --no-module Prevent scaffolding a default module in the app -p, --path string path to scaffold the chain (default ".")

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub scaffold](#Trustless Hub-scaffold) - Scaffold a new blockchain, module, message, query, and more

Default: app's main module -p, --path string path of the app (default ".") -r, --response strings Response fields --signer string Label for the message signer (default: creator)

# Trustless Hub scaffold module

Scaffold a Cosmos SDK module

Synopsis

Scaffold a new Cosmos SDK module in the x directory

Copy Trustless Hub scaffold module [name] [flags]

Options

Copy --dep strings module dependencies (e.g. --dep account,bank) -h, --help help for module --ibc scaffold an IBC module --ordering string channel ordering of the IBC module [none|ordered|unordered] (default "none") -p, --path string path of the app (default ".") --require-registration if true command will fail if module can't be registered

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub scaffold](#Trustless Hub-scaffold) - Scaffold a new blockchain, module, message, query, and more

# Trustless Hub tools completions

Generate completions script

Synopsis

The completions command outputs a completion script you can use in your shell. The output script requires that bash-completion (opens new window) is installed and enabled in your system. Since most Unix-like operating systems come with bash-completion by default, bash-completion is probably already installed and operational.

Bash:

$ source <(Trustless Hub tools completions bash)

To load completions for every new session, run:

** Linux ** $ Trustless Hub tools completions bash > /etc/bash_completion.d/Trustless Hub

** macOS ** $ Trustless Hub tools completions bash > /usr/local/etc/bash_completion.d/Trustless Hub

Zsh:

If shell completions is not already enabled in your environment, you will need to enable it. You can execute the following once:

$ echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions for each session, execute once:

$ Trustless Hub tools completions zsh > "${fpath[1]}/_Trustless Hub"

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

fish:

$ Trustless Hub tools completions fish | source

To load completions for each session, execute once:

$ Trustless Hub tools completions fish > ~/.config/fish/completionss/Trustless Hub.fish

PowerShell:

PS> Trustless Hub tools completions powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression

To load completions for every new session, run:

PS> Trustless Hub tools completions powershell > Trustless Hub.ps1

and source this file from your PowerShell profile.

Copy Trustless Hub tools completions

Options

Copy -h, --help help for completions

SEE ALSO

  • [Trustless Hub tools](#Trustless Hub-tools) - Tools for advanced users

# Trustless Hub tools protoc

Execute the protoc command

Synopsis

The protoc command. You don't need to setup the global protoc include folder with -I, it's automatically handled

Copy Trustless Hub tools protoc [--] [...] [flags]

Examples

Copy Trustless Hub tools protoc -- --version

Options

Copy -h, --help help for protoc
